page.title: 16Religion in Woburn
page.content: There is only one church in Woburn. This is dedicated to{St. Mary}and replaced the old church which was demolished in 1864 because it was too small for the increasing population (then 2000).{William 8th Duke of {Bedford,}commissioned{Henry Clutton}to design the church which was built on a new site in Park Street. The building is regarded as one of the finest examples of{Gothic revival.}The most striking features of the church are the{reredos}and the{organ.}The carved reredos depicts{'The adoration {of the Magi'.}It was designed by{W D {Caroe}and executed in Oberammergau. The organ is reputed to be one of the finest village church organs in the country. It is a three manual designed by{Norman and Beard}and installed in 1904. Two old bibles date back to 1737 and 1855.
